column1: Appeal shall  be  exercised  by the Supreme Court and  not by the Court of Appeal  and that section
49(3)  of  the  Judicature  Act  is  an
column2: instance  where  Parliament  has  specifically  provided  for  a

column1: particular "category" of case,  i.e., cases  in  which a judge of the Supreme Court is  a party.  It was
his contention that there can  be  no doubt that the words "shall be heard or determined by some
other Judge or Judges of the said court" in section 49(3) of the Judicature Act refers to the "court"
in which the party to the case  is  a judge which in this case  is the Supreme Court.
